solution_line_template: She bakes a turkey for {minutes_per_pound} minutes a pound and the turkey is {turkey_weight} pounds so it takes {minutes_per_pound}*{turkey_weight} = <<{minutes_per_pound}*{turkey_weight}={time_per_turkey_minutes}>>{time_per_turkey_minutes} minutes

She has {num_turkeys} turkeys to roast and one turkey takes {time_per_turkey_minutes} minutes to cook so {num_turkeys} turkeys will take {num_turkeys}*{time_per_turkey_minutes} = <<{num_turkeys}*{time_per_turkey_minutes}={total_cooking_time_minutes}>>{total_cooking_time_minutes} minutes

There are {minutes_per_hour} minutes in an hour and these turkeys will take {total_cooking_time_minutes} minutes to cook so that's {total_cooking_time_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour} = <<{total_cooking_time_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour}={total_cooking_time_hours}>>{total_cooking_time_hours} hours

In military time, 6:00 pm is 18:00 hours (12 hours +6 hours) and it takes {total_cooking_time_hours} hours to cook the turkeys so the latest she can start is 18- {total_cooking_time_hours} = {start_time_am_hour}:00 am
